main event: On 3 January 1956 at Scott AFB, Illinois, a circular orange object with a green tail was observed by military personnel. The object made no sound and had a gradual climb at high speed before disappearing overhead.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 45 seconds and was classified as a Ground-Visual type of observation.
The source of the report was military personnel, indicating potentially credible witnesses.
The object was initially classified as a meteor sighting, but the conclusions listed possibilities of it being a balloon, plasma, or aircraft.
The sighting occurred at night, and the object disappeared as though its lighted characteristics were extinguished.
The report also includes details about the reliability of the observation and possible causes, suggesting thorough investigation.
sighted object: circular orange object with green tail
